CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 4, 1952, pg. 17, reads: "W. C. Handy Congratulates Churchill Kohlman - When W. C.Handy, the now-blind musician and author, who composed 'The St. Louis Blues' many years ago, came to Pittsburgh Friday to appear at the Greater Pittsgurgh [Pittsburgh] Improvement League's benefit auditions entitled 'Big Break of 1953,' he met Churchill Kohlman, Pittsburgh resident and author of the hit song, 'Cry.' - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: W. C. Handy shaking hands with Churchill Kohlman, standing in interior for Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League's benefit "Big Break of 1953"
